name: Two File Example Exploration
description: A test lesson with two files to explore.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: Hi everyone, Chris here with another CodeVideo update.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: You'll notice already two things different than previous codevideos. Most notably, we're able to start of with any number of files or folders in the file explorer.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: This opens up a world of new possibilities, like making lessons about existing codebases, or continuing a lesson from a point of a previous lesson.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: You'll also notice at the bottom left we now have this dev box, which displays various variables used in the CodeVideo component. It can be very helpful for debugging why your codevideo might not be looking just as expected.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: Alright - let's get into these files and start by opening package JSON.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: The package JSON is just a dummy package JSON for testing.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: This would be the main entry point, but for now it's also just a dummy JavaScript file.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: Alright, that's it for this short demo! Let's close up these tabs and call it a day.

actions.name: author-speak-before
actions.value: Perfect - right back where we started! Until next time, happy coding!
